A Descent into Madness

Dimly lit room, anxious man, sweat dripping  
He’s spiraling into dark thoughts.  
“I’m a louse, vile and loathsome.”  

“I aimed to be just, but…”  
“Why do I hate my mother now?”  

“Shall I tell her? No!”  
“Why can’t I bear them near?”  

---  

Eyes wide, ceiling above him, panic rising  
“Can anything compare to this horror?”  
“I’ll never forgive the old woman!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist grapples with intense feelings of guilt and self-loathing after committing murder, reflecting on his motivations and the horror of his actions.
